poem:
"Whirling time in the Museum of Memories"

Brothers wind the hands of cuckoo clocks,
In our museum where silence seldom talks.
The velvet hum of history aloft in each tick,
Sealed by an electrical engineer's nostalgic trick.
Who will inherit this music of gears,
When the brothers bow to unfounded fears?
Smallest of museums, yet grand in their part,
Preserving time's echo in the art of heart.
